Articles.Content: Just say how you found Kerbal Space Program. Was it from Robbaz the YouTuber? Or Did a friend tell you about it?
I found the game from a YouTuber called, \'Robbaz\'. It looked very cool, so I downloaded the demo. It was boss, so I bought the game.

Yep, Robbaz....

'Nipple Sky Penetrator 1'.....

'Houston....Call for pizza, I\'m hungry...'
I heard that someone was doing a 'Far lands or bust' series, I googled it and found kurtjmac\'s channel. When I looked at the channel I saw some KSP videos, and that\'s pretty much how it happened.
I subbed a guy called Kikoskia a while back on you tube. He did a lets play recently, I had to buy this game...So I did.
This thread posted on Orbiter-Forum. It announced the first release, 0.7.3

A friend of mine on another forum (little community of friends, really... not a big forum, only about 30-40 active members) posted a thread about it. I thought it was the most awesome thing I had ever seen... and it was. This was back around the 0.8 release...

I think he\'s glad to have made such an impact on my life. Don\'t even think he plays it that much.
Nice, I just really can\'t wait to see the 0.16 version. =) I\'m happy the game is growing so rapidly!

I was feeling bored during the summer of last year, so I naturally went to Google. I looked up various things, played Orbiter for the first time in a few months, then found myself wanting to do more than fly. I wanted to run a space program. So, being as naive as I was, I googled 'space program simulators' or something along the lines of such. I found a Wikipedia page on space simulators, and found a surprisingly interesting one named 'Kerbal Space Program.' Thus, I googled that and found our illustrious game.
Someone made a thread about it on another forum I frequent. I tried the demo, got hooked, and the next day I bought it.
When the Yogscast\'s Sips did a couple of videos on it, I immediately downloaded.

This thread posted on Orbiter-Forum. It announced the first release, 0.7.3

This is how I found it as well. Of course I had to buy it, and I\'ve been hooked ever since. I\'ve even made a semi-tutorial video. I\'m still learning though, so I plan to make more informed videos once I\'ve truly gotten my skills up.

http://youtu.be/5wlhz7s4J78
A friend at the university I\'m at mentioned it, and so I went and tried it out!
Universe Sandbox, which is also pretty cool, check it out, listed KSP as being a fellow gravity-simulating software toy.
iRacing.
Chickenkeeper
I found out about it from Universe Sandbox.

Roaming the Youtubes;

I investigated the game a bit more and now, here I am.
Random comment on /.
The Arma2 official forums has an offtopic board, people were discussing different space simulators.
PC Gamer magazine. Back during version 0.9, they made an article on it.

'Hi, my name is Kurt, and welcome to the Kerbal Space Program!'

\'Nuff said.
I\'ve seen it first on reddit and then started playing it as kurtjmac made the first videos
Anthony Gallegos from Rebel FM Pod-Cast
One of Notches tweets.
